origination.corpname: University of Michigan. Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics.

did.unittitle: Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics (University of Michigan) records 1879-1997 1896-1968
did.abstract: Governing body for intercollegiate athletics at the University of Michigan. Records consist of correspondence, minutes, reports, petitions, account books, contracts, photographs, and scrapbooks relating primarily to the operation of the athletic department, including files of directors Fielding H. Yost, Herbert O. (Fritz) Crisler, and Don Canham, and athletic administrators Charles Baird and Philip G. Bartelme.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The records have been acquired in several accessions through the Board in Control and the Athletic Department. (Donor 1776)

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics (University of Michigan) records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics was formed in 1893 to assert a measure of faculty control over athletics. It assumed overall responsibility for athletic policy and financial management, but the Student Athletic Association continued to play a role in athletics until 1920. The board originally consisted of nine members; five chosen from the faculty senate by President Angell and four undergraduates, at first selected by the Board of Directors of the Athletic Association but later chosen by the student body. The Athletic Director traditionally served as secretary of the board

The Board has undergone a number of reorganizations, most notably in the period 1909-1914 and again in 1925-26. The reorganizations resulted in changes in the Boards, authority, composition and methods by which members were selected or appointed. Under the 1925/26 revisions, the board in control was an independently chartered corporation with considerable autonomy. In 1997 the board's status as a separately incorporated body. The management of the Athletic Department was brought more directly under the authority of the University President. The Board in Control was reorganized as the Advisory Board on Intercollegiate Athletics.

scopecontent.p: Papers, 1879 and 1891-1955, of the Board in Control of Intercollegiate Athletics of the University of Michigan [formerly the Athletic Association, include correspondence, reports, petitions, account books, contracts, and scrapbooks relating primarily to the operation of the athletic department, including files of athletic directors Fielding H. Yost and Herbert O. (Fritz) Crisler, and athletic administrators, Charles Baird and Philip G. Bartelme.

The Correspondence series covers the full gamut of topics relating to intercollegiate athletics at Michigan, ranging from broad policy issues to facilities construction and management, scheduling of games, relations with the conference and other schools, relations with the university administration and faculty, and requests for and complaints about tickets. The series is arranged chronologically, generally with several folders for each year.

odd.p: (February 1938 includes notes by BIC member James Duffy on hiring of H.O. Crisler)

scopecontent.p: The Annual Reports series, 1911/12-1967/68, consists of the board's report to the Regents. It usually included a summary of the year's activities and finances and overviews of facilities construction and renovation and significant personnel changes.

odd.p: (includes original reports and photocopies of printed reports from Regents Proceedings and other sources)

scopecontent.p: The Topical files series (13 linear feet) (32 linear feet) is an alphabetically arrange subject file. The earliest file is the articles of incorporation of the Athletic Association in 1879, but the bulk of the series from the 1920s to 1954 covering the tenures of athletic directors Fielding H, Yost and Herbert O Crisler.

did.unittitle: Detroit, University of 1930 (proposed game for unemployed)
Freshmen Rule 1942 (Suspension of rule during World War II)
UM's return to Intercollegiate Football conference 1913
Physical Education and Athletics, Department of
Yost sketch: "A Day with Professor Yost"
Board in Control of Physical Education
Petitions re: the naming of Yost Field House
Physical Education Departments' Reports, etc. undated
Report of the Department of Intercollegiate Athletics 1921-1925
Reports and Resolutions of the Board in Control of Athletics 1924-1928

scopecontent.p: The Michigan Stadium series (1.2 linear feet) contains documentation of the planning, financing and construction of the stadium. It includes correspondence, reports, promotional material, construction documents (though not blueprints) and records of bond sales and several original bonds.

odd.p: (photos and articles on other athletic stadia)

scopecontent.p: The Land deeds series includes deeds and related records for property acquired for construction of various Athletic Department facilities including Ferry Field, Michigan Stadium, and the golf course.

odd.p: (Includes a listing of deeds for Ferry Field, Michigan Stadium and Golf Course parcels)

did.unittitle: Ferry Field, Linn/Felch Farm (South of Ferry Field)
Papers relating to Michigan Stadium land deed

scopecontent.p: The Reports and Miscellaneous Files series (1.2 linear feet) includes a variety of reports dating from 1926 to 1942, including a "Ten Year Report, 1921-1931", covering Fielding Yost's first ten years as athletic director, and three volumes of financial journals which include a record of capital expenditures on athletic facilities through 1968.

did.unittitle: Minutes of the Intercollegiate Conference, Faculty Representatives 1980-1986

odd.p: (taken from the papers of Donald Canham)

did.unittitle: Intercollegiate Conference and National Collegiate Athletic Association published materials
Stock Certificate of Intercollegiate Conference Athletic Association

scopecontent.p: Photographs consists primarily of football and baseball team photos and a 1923 photo album of the dedication of Yost Field House. Included in the album are pictures of the Field House Dedication and the football game against the Quanitco Marines team, photos from the 1923 Ohio state game, posed shots of players from 1922-1923, and an action photo from the 1902 Minnesota football game. Other items of note include an outsize, panorama of action from the 1902 Tournament of Roses game (All of the football team photos and the Tournament of Roses photo are online in the Bentley Image Bank)

odd.p: (Includes Dedication of the Yost Field House, 1923 Marines vs. Mich. November 10, 1923, 1902 Minnesota game; miscellaneous)

did.unittitle: Board in Control Minutes, agenda and related material

scopecontent.p: The Board in Control minutes series consist of a complete run of minutes, 1896-1997 and meeting agendas, 1968-1989 (Don Canham's tenure as Athletic Director.)

odd.p: (taken from the papers of Donald Canham)

did.unittitle: Agendas of Board meetings 1967-1988 (taken from the papers of Donald Canham

odd.p: (mainly concerning question of return to conference)
